text: Bernard "Bernie" Hartigan (born 1943) is an Irish retired hurler who played as a midfielder for the Limerick senior team. Hartigan made his first appearance for the team during the 1964 championship and was a regular member of the starting for the next decade. During that time he won one All-Ireland medal, two Munster medals and one National Hurling League medal. At club level, Hartigan was a one-time county football championship medalist with Old Christians. Hartigan's brother, Pat, was also an All-Ireland medalist with Limerick. ==References== Category:1943 births Category:Living people Category:Old Christians hurlers Category:Limerick inter-county hurlers Category:Munster inter-provincial hurlers Category:All-Ireland Senior Hurling Championship winners Category:Hurling selectors
title: Bernie Hartigan
